author: Odeinoichus
title: Could have been Improved Upon.
review:
Set #30271 Mikey’s Mini-Shellraiser: This is a surprising addition for your ninja turtles collection, unfortunately it’s not as army builder friendly as the previous turtle polybag. Still it’s an interesting polybag, so read on and find out if it’s worth the effort to track it down.

Pros:

  • Instructions are easy to follow.

  • Mini-Shellraiser looks awesome, and is a great little micro-build of the larger vehicle. This is meant to be a radio controlled weapon the turtles use and even that is such a fun little idea that the classic turtles would cook up as a defensive or offensive piece of their arsenal.

Cons:

  • Piece count is a bit weak.

  • Mikey is not unique to this set, he is also found in a larger set the Kraang Lab Escape and he doesn’t have any weapons. Just the remote control for the mini-shellraiser. Slightly disappointing there.

  • Considering the piece count for this polybag, it might have been better if it included a Foot Soldier for Mikey to fight against.

Overall opinion

Overall if you’re solely interested in polybags you’re going to enjoy this set mostly for the mini-shellraiser. Otherwise it’s a bit of a disappointment, the piece count isn’t very good and the minifigure isn’t unique. And doesn’t come with weapons, for a ninja turtle that’s a real issue. I’d say somewhat recommended here, you can skip this if you aren’t looking to complete the entire Theme 100%.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: Unlike the key ring , I actually care
review:
Opening;

Mikeys mini shell raiser is the only non key ring tmnt set that I own and I quite like it despite my lack of knowledge or interest in the source material .

The Minifigures-

The minifigure has a nicely moulded head with a concentred face print , the shell is a nice piece with printing to represent a strap , the torso has printing which finally flows into the legs . The Accessory included is a walkie talkie elements with a 1×1 red stud on it to represent a button . 

The build-

The build has some clipped on flaps with nice 1×2 tiles in a dark pink , the wheels to ward the back are bigger than the two at the front , there is very nice olive green sloping on top and a red assembly .

In conclusion-

this is a set I appreciate as a Lego fan because I have no attachment to this franchise , but unlike a key ring that I don't need I would recommend this as it has interesting pieces and a cool figure .
